subject: Technology
title: Life on the International Space Station
description: Learn Life on the International Space Station in one minute.

hook.text: The ISS is a house the size of a football field, flying at 17,500 mph, 250 miles above your head.

buildup.text: Up to six astronauts live there at once. They work, eat, sleep, and exercise in microgravity.

discovery.text: Everything floats. Astronauts strap themselves into sleeping bags on the wall so they don't drift away.

twist.text: Without gravity, muscles and bones waste away fast. Astronauts must exercise two hours every single day.

climax.text: The ISS has been continuously occupied since November 2000. It is humanity's longest space experiment.

punchline.text: Humans have lived in space nonstop for over two decades.

quiz.question: Why must ISS astronauts exercise two hours daily?
options: To prevent muscle and bone loss from microgravity
To generate electricity for the station
